DOC.brief_summary: This study is to compare the clinical outcome of Precizon toric intraocular lens(IOL) to that of Tecnis toric IOL.
DOC.brief_title: Comparison of Clinical Outcomes of Toric Intraocular Lens
DOC.detailed_description: In cataract surgery, after phacoemulsification, intraocular lens should be implanted for patient's better visual acuity. When patient has large amount of corneal astigmatism, toric intraocular lens are recommended to correct the preexisting astigmatism.
DOC.criteria: Patient with cataract and regular corneal astigmatism(between 0.50 diopter and 2.50 diopter considering both anterior and posterior corneal surface) Amblyopia, irregular astigmatism, corneal opacity, glaucoma, retinal disease, history of ocular inflammation, previous other intraocular surgery
